title: Calories in Pigs in a Blanket
meta_description: Discover pigs in a blanket calories per piece, including macros like protein, carbs, fat, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: Calories in Pigs in a Blanket
assumptions: Standard mini beef or pork sausage (about 10g) wrapped in crescent roll dough, baked; no added sauces or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, sausage type, dough recipe, size, and baking method. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One pig in a blanket has about 65 kcal, with 6g carbs and 2g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp mustard dipping sauce per piece
Use turkey sausage instead of beef/pork

faqs.q: How many calories in one pig in a blanket?
faqs.a: Approximately 65 kcal per standard baked piece.

faqs.q: What are the macros for pigs in a blanket calories?
faqs.a: Per piece: 6g carbs, 2g protein, 4g fat, 200mg sodium.

faqs.q: Are pigs in a blanket high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, due to the sausageâ€”about 200mg per piece.

faqs.q: How do homemade pigs in a blanket calories compare to store-bought?
faqs.a: Homemade can be lower if using lean sausage and less dough; varies by recipe.

faqs.q: Can I make low-calorie pigs in a blanket?
faqs.a: Yes, opt for veggie sausages or phyllo dough to reduce calories by 10-20 per piece.
